definitions.text: declare to be true or admit the existence or reality or truth of
examples: She acknowledged that she might have forgotten

definitions.text: allow to enter; grant entry to
examples: We cannot admit non-members into our club building

definitions.text: allow participation in or the right to be part of; permit to exercise the rights, functions, and responsibilities of
examples: She was admitted to the New Jersey Bar

definitions.text: admit into a group or community
examples: We'll have to vote on whether or not to admit a new member
This problem admits of no solution
This short story allows of several different interpretations
The French doors admit onto the yard

definitions.text: have room for; hold without crowding
examples: The auditorium can't hold more than 500 people

definitions.text: serve as a means of entrance
examples: This ticket will admit one adult to the show
